body.p:
To His Excellency
Thos. E. Bramlet
Governor of Kentucky
We the undersigned Jurors who tried Conrad Wolfe at the January Term of the Jefferson Circuit Court, do most earnestly recommend him To Executive Clemency.

Said Conrad Wolfe is a Soldier belonging to the 63 Ohio Volunteers. He volunteered about two years & a half ago, & his Regiment has been in the Army of the Cumberland; he has reenlisted for three years, & at the time of his arrest he with this Regiment was on a short furlough To his home in Ohio.
We again reiterate that we earnestly recommend him to Executive Clemency. He is now only near 19 years of age

W. W. Powers.
J J hart
John. T. Wood
A Gunter
H W Wilkes
Wm Tait
A B Semple foreman
Wm G Cornell
J. D. Seaton
Jas Stephens
A. H. Patch
Thos. P. Hughes

State of Kentucky
January 14 1864

I James P Chambers Clerk of the Jefferson Circuit Court in the State aforesaid that the foregoing are the names of the twelve jurors in the case of Commonwealth versus Conrad Wolfe alias Cooney this day convicted of felony

Given under my hand this 14 January 1864
James P Chambers C

I unite in the foregoing petition
Bland Bollard

So do I
P. B. Muir

Jas. P. Chambers
W. G. Reasor City Atty
I trust the soldier may do his county some service in the army

J R Dupuy
Com' atty
Charity extends behond the Grave &c
Phil Tomppert Jr C. C. C. L.

Governor Bramlet
Dear Sir
We introduce To you Jas. C. Gill Esqr formerly a member of the Louisville Legion, wounded at the battle of Shiloh now coroner of this county.
He will explain to your Excellency the object of this petition

Respectfully
Baird & Price
Attorneys for Wolfe

Jefferson Cir Ct
vs
Conrad Wolfe

Pardon & send by mail care of Jas C Gill or Baird & Price
Tho E Bramlette
